ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: when the baby girl buried alive is asked
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And the little girl buried alive is asked
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and when the girl-child buried alive shall be asked:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: questions are asked about the baby girls buried alive,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And when the girl-child who was buried alive is asked.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And when the female infant (Al-Maw'udah) buried alive is questioned (Su'ilat):
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And when the female infant buried alive is asked
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: when the buried infant shall be asked
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And when the girl-child that was buried alive is asked
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: and when the female infant buried alive is asked
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And when the girl buried alive shall be asked:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: when the girl buried-alive will be asked
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: When the female (infant), buried alive, is questioned -
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And when the female (infant) buried alive (as the pagan Arabs used to do) shall be questioned.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: when the buried female infant is asked
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: When the girl, buried alive, is asked:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And when the girl [who was] buried alive is asked
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [81:8] and when the girl buried-alive, the young girl buried alive for fear of shame and impoverishment, asks — in rebuke of its slayer —
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And when the girl child that was buried alive is asked) i.e. when she asks her father
